instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO VIDEO problem, all powers present
threads.message:
hi guys,
having a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. board looks never touched before, no liquid spilled.
problem is no video, check all rails, basically all power present.including  cpu vcore,gpu power

no beeps at all, either with or without ram.  suspected the GPU ,which is a common problem of this model, then BGA and replaced with new one
(yes we did a lot of replacement of this model for the GPU, and all work out)

but still same thing,tried another bios, but same thing

really get stuck and don't have idea where to start now.

any advice would be appreciated.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO VIDEO problem, all powers present
threads.message: Is there beep without RAM? Connect the speaker in the case!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO VIDEO problem, all powers present
threads.message: yes connected left and right speaker already. but no beeps at all, either with RAM or without RAM

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2011 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO VIDEO problem, all powers present
threads.message: Remove GPU and see if it beeps. If not I don't think there is much you can do anymore.
